[Home](doc/markdown/./index.md) &gt; [@zephyr3d/base](doc/markdown/./base.md) &gt; [HttpFS](doc/markdown/./base.httpfs.md)

## HttpFS class

HTTP-backed virtual file system.

Provides a read-only VFS implementation that resolves files via HTTP(S). Supports: - File reads via `GET` - Existence/stat probing via `HEAD` - Optional directory listing via pluggable [HttpDirectoryReader](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreader.md)<!-- -->s

Limitations: - This FS is read-only; mutating operations throw `VFSError` with code `"EROFS"`<!-- -->. - Partial reads (HTTP range) are not implemented yet.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare class HttpFS extends VFS 
```
**Extends:** [VFS](doc/markdown/./base.vfs.md)

## Constructors

<table><thead><tr><th>

Constructor


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[(constructor)(baseURL, options)](doc/markdown/./base.httpfs._constructor_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Creates an HTTP file system rooted at `baseURL`<!-- -->.

All relative VFS paths are resolved against `baseURL` and fetched using the configured options.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

## Properties

<table><thead><tr><th>

Property


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[urlResolver](doc/markdown/./base.httpfs.urlresolver.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

(url: string) =&gt; string


</td><td>

Optional URL resolver hook that transforms VFS paths into concrete URLs.

If present, it is applied by [VFS.normalizePath()](doc/markdown/./base.vfs.normalizepath.md) before other checks.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

[normalizePath(path)](doc/markdown/./base.httpfs.normalizepath.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Normalizes a VFS path for HTTP use.

Behavior: - Applies `urlResolver` if provided. - If the result is a data URI or an object URL, it is returned as-is. - Otherwise falls back to the base VFS `normalizePath` logic.


</td></tr>
